comment.returns: promise to provide the stdout and stderr streams form the child process.

tags.text:
executes `command` in a child process and promises to return the stdout and stderr streams. 
let utils = require('./cpUtils');
utils.exec(cmd)
.then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
.catch(err => {...});

comment.text: the options to pass along to the shell

comment.shortText:
# Excel
Convenience functions to access tables in Excel files.
Uses the {@link https://github.com/SheetJS/js-xlsx Sheet JS xlsx parser and writer}.
A structure describing an Excel table

comment.returns: an object of functions providing access to the contents of the excel file.

comment.text: the name of the Excel file to read

comment.shortText: appends to a file either as binary or text and promises no return.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
determines if `thePath` is a file and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
determines if `thePath` exists and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
lists all files in a directory and promises to provide the list.

comment.shortText: reads a file either as binary or text and promises to provide the content.
reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
determines the canonical path for `thePath`, resolving all symbolic links and '../'in the path.
comment.returns: promise to provide the real canonical system path.

comment.shortText: promises to delete a file or folder.
writes a file either as binary or text and promises no return.

comment.shortText: writes a text file and promises no return.

comment.shortText:
Logging convenience functions. ## Usage 
import log from './log';
log.info('by the way:'); // -> 20160817 09:59:08.032 info by the way:
log.error('oh dear!');   // -> 20160817 09:59:08.045 error *** oh dear!
Type definition for level descriptors
Debug reporting level with importance 0
Warning reporting level with importance 3
Info reporting level with importance 1
Info reporting level with importance 2
current date format string. See [date module]('_date_.html')
current reporting level, same across all modules
name of the current log file, or undefined
map of valid reporting levels
# hsNode
comment.text:
Helpful Scripts functions that wrap some nodejs calls in Promise wrappers.
[Github page](https://github.com/HelpfulScripts/hsNode)

## Index of nodejs wrappers
-   {@link child_processs cpUtil} child process execution
-   {@link file system fsUtil} file system functions
-   {@link http httpUtil} web server functions

## Index of other node support functions
-   {@link log log} logging support
-   {@link excel excel} reading and writing Excel files
